text:
Found it on :
• This function call stores the data in the tracker, but the data is not actually passed to HubSpot with this call. The data will only be passed when tracking a page view or an event (with either the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/tracking-code#track-page-view|trackPageView> or <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/tracking-code#events-js-api|trackEvent> functions).
Need to pass a pageView after a identify!

Hi everyone, I am so sorry to bother you. I have accidentally deleted my email marketing. I have researched and there’s a chance that I can restore it. However, I am not familiar with API. Could someone help me or guide me through API please?
Hi Thanh. You can ask support team to restore it for you

I did use the Live Chat. And she shared with me this link: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/cms_email/restore-a-deleted-marketing-email> I’m trying to learn it but I am not a developer. Do you have the link of Support team?
Or could you please guide me through the HubSpot API?
They should be able to restore it on their side. Maybe they don’t know about it. Do you want to share the portal ID with me by private message and I can do it

Hey all - Probably being very stupid but can't find the widget/module to edit the scrolling COVID banner at the top of this website. Anyone got any ideas where in wordpress i'll find it? <https://www.vfe.co.uk/>
Hello everyone, does anyone know a solution/app that supports custom object property mapping from a form into HubSpot? Apps such as Gravity Forms, Jotform, Formstack, etc.

like this?
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Releases-and-Updates/Now-Live-Custom-Objects-Properties-available-in-Forms/ba-p/540359>
Yes, but using a Form solution outside of HubSpot
I guess I’d recommend listing what form solution outside of HubSpot you’re aiming to use. Then folks may be able to make some recommendations.

Yeah, I know a custom module could be used and I did that for some of it. Some of it I need to be outside of a module and was hoping something could be done with those. Guess not. Thanks for the input guys!
Question.,..is it possible to create dnd areas in blog post templates?
I'm guessing No since I have an error regarding that..
Sadly, no. Coming someday.

You can however use web components in tandem with the insert embed code feature.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/blog/use-web-components-in-HubSpot-cms-development#:~:text=Web%20components%20are%20the%20web's,modules%20and%20templates%20as%20needed>.

Noooo, web components are my HubSpot secret weapon. :satisfied: but yeah, highly recommend, HubSpot works very well with web components and also allows you to do “modules inside of modules.” I didn't know you had a write up about them, Jon, pretty cool.

haha sorry to reveal your secret weapon.

It’s pretty darn powerful once you realize what you can do with web components on HubSpot.

Fun fact: The code blocks used all across the <http://developers.HubSpot.com|developers.HubSpot.com> website and developer blog use a code block web component I built.
That component powers multiple custom modules and is used for code blocks in our developer blog.

offloading the code block rendering to the web component drastically simplifies the module development, and that same web component can easily be used in situations where different JS frameworks are used.
This is the HTML you write to get a code block with 2 tabs, syntax highlighting, and line numbers
Interesting! Ah this is like the reactjs(or any js framework) version of Hubl lol I like what I see here. I'll check in with my team about this
Thank you Jon!

<@U03HJ9C5881>
> Interesting! Ah this is like the reactjs(or any js framework) version of Hubl lol I like what I see here. I’ll check in with my team about this
It’s actually like the React/Vue version of HTML. It’s a standard web feature, you make your own actual HTML elements, that the browser knows how to render.

You can certainly just like with any HTML use it in tandem with HubL to make the editing experience great.

Best of all, because it’s using built-in web technology, you can plug your web components into any JS framework and it largely just works (Some frameworks may have minor things you have to do just to tell the framework it exists).

One of our clients is receiving a prospect email notification and the page title is pulling in with the wrong language. All site language settings appear to be in English. It’s happening for all prospect email notifications for page visits. Any ideas on how this might happen?
It appears to be happening in another portal as well. We’ve submitted a support ticket.

Anyone know the magic format to include core header module styling in a template??
```    {% dnd_module path="@HubSpot/header",
      header_tag='h1',
      value='My Header'
    %}```
So there's this... but what about when you what changes from the styles tab to customize font-size, colors, etc? Zero documentation for this.
